results.title: Tennessee volunteers
results.brief_description: A project was sponsored by the University of Tennessee to build a children’s playground with the help of the community. In this way, building costs were low, and children involved gained more respect for the equipment, having helped to build it. Members of the community brought their own tools and gave their time, whilst local businesses donated equipment and the use of machinery.

results.title: Ten bob in winter
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Reckford and British Film Institute Experimental Film Fund
results.brief_description: Unemployed, a young coloured man living in London borrows ten shillings to see him through until he gets a job. He has no luck at the Employment Exchange, and to add to his troubles, he is `touched’ by an out-of-work fellow countryman who needs ten shillings to redeem his guitar from the pawnbroker so that he can play at a dance. While the musician is in the shop, the young man meets a rather snobbish well-off friend from whom he tries to conceal his position - a humorous position well exploited. Sharp evocation of its time - duffel coats and modern jazz score by the Joe Harriot Quintet.

results.title: Tell my wife I won't be home for dinner
results.creator_credit: Jack Duncan, Paul Ferguson and Cygnet Guild Communications
results.brief_description: Three case studies demonstrate a variety of examples of common mismanagement of time and their consequences. This film offers guidance on how to recognise ineffective time management and to establish effective time use rules.

results.title: Telephone factor
results.brief_description: The telephone has long since become the foremost means of communication throughout the world. The film shows a wide range of modern telephone techniques. In an attractive presentation which takes the audience on a trip around the world, it shows the numerous possibilities of the telephone applied to all walks of life, from the private household to international enterprises.

results.title: Tech talk. Episodes 13 and 14
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. Details of what various jobs entail, the necessary qualifications and how to go about getting the job are provided. There is also a segment on survival skills. This program presented by Michael Schildberger covers the following topics:- motor mechanic, dental assistant, supermarket worker/checkout operator, how to use the CES part 1, working in the kitchen as a chef/cook, fitter and turner, recreation officer and how to use the CES part 2.

results.title: Teapot town
results.brief_description: Charming animated teapots thwart the ancient order of droops and preserve marital harmony. Drinking tea is also demonstrated to combat noise pollution promote workplace solidarity, and inspire carnal passions. A very fine example of American studio animation of the period. The animation suggests the hand of the maturing Frank Tashlin. Music is a little fey, but quite sweet in its well intentioned way. Music score by Richard Dupage.

results.title: Team Building (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A group can achieve results greater than the sum of its parts. This program makes recommendations on how to build and maintain an organisational team and discusses several elements that can prevent teams from succeeding.

results.title: Teaching machines and programmed learning
results.brief_description: B.F. Skinner explains the theory of programmed learning; Arthur Lumsdaine describes its application in machines and materials available; and Robert Glaser speaks of the implications of these for education. The advantages of the method are that individual students work at their own rate, progress is made apparent and the ease of learning gives encouragement.

results.title: Teaching crutch walking
results.brief_description: Shows how the physical therapist teaches the bed patient reconditioning exercises; how to teach the patient to walk in a walker; how to teach the various methods of crutch walking - two-point, four-point, and swing; how to teach the patient to sit, rise and climb stairs; and the safety factors involved in crutch walking.
